key_title: Key to the species of Senecio

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Asteraceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Senecio
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1999). Senecio. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Capitula radiate, i.e. outer florets ligulate, female; inner florets tubular, bisexual (but ligules much reduced or vestigial in S. glossanthus, S. halophilus and S. productus)
Capitula non-radiate, outer florets female or bisexual; inner florets bisexual
Scrambling or semi-climbing perennial to c. 5 m high; leaves rhombic to ovate (often broadly toothed), 3–5 cm long, rather fleshy; garden-escape
Habit and foliage not as above
Ligules rich purple (rarely white); coastal weed with pinnatisect foliage
Ligules yellow
Ligules minute, to 2 mm long
Ligules conspicuous, at least 3 mm long
Involucral bracts 12 or 13 in majority of capitula; female florets 8–13; ligule vestigial; cypselas of female florets 3–6 mm long, slightly lageniform
Involucral bracts 7–10, or occasionally to 13, in a majority of capitula; female florets predominantly 4–8; ligule vestigial or to 2 mm; cypselas of female florets 2–3.5 mm long, not lageniform

Involucre 3.5–6 mm long; calycular bracteoles 0.2–0.5 mm wide; mature receptacle 1–2(–2.5) mm diam.; ligules generally exceeding involucre; hairs on cypselas of bisexual florets 0.05–0.15 mm long, barely exceeding pappus ring

Involucre 5–7 mm long; calycular bracteoles 0.5–1 mm wide; mature receptacle mostly 2–3.5 mm diam.; ligules not exceeding involucre; hairs on achenes of bisexual florets 0.2–0.3 mm long, clearly exceeding pappus ring
Involucral bracts fused for at least half their length prior to fruit ripening; bracteoles absent; ligules relatively large (to c. 2 cm long); glaucous annual of far north-west
Involucral bracts fused for less than half their length (usually almost or entirely free); bracteoles usually present
Leaves white-tomentose beneath
Leaves glabrous to sparsely pubescent beneath (sometimes mealy-white in rare S. behrianus from northern Victoria)
Larger leaves at least 25 mm wide, those at least of main axis with stem-clasping bases; north-east only and rare
Leaves to c. 20 mm wide, without stem-clasping bases
Involucre cylindric with 9–12 bracts; leaves entire or shallowly toothed
Involucre rather broadly campanulate with 18–22 bracts; at least the lower leaves with several deeply incised, forward-pointing teeth
Involucral bracts and bracteoles sparsely to densely covered with black glandular papillae; cypselas glabrous, blackish with broad, somewhat wrinkled ribs
Involucral bracts and bracteoles not glandular; cypselas not as above
Cypselas of ray florets c. 1 mm longer than those of disc florets; bracteoles with intense purple pigmentation in distal half to one third
Cypselas of ray florets equal or hardly longer than those of disc florets, or if clearly longer then bracteoles without intense purple pigmentation
Leaves pinnatifid to bipinnatisect (primary lobes divided at least halfway to midrib)
Leaves entire or with shallowly toothed or lobed margins
Involucre 7–10 mm long; cypselas evenly and densely white-pubescent with persistent pappus; far north-west only
Involucre less than 7 mm long; cypselas minutely hairy in rows or glabrous

Inflorescence with numerous (c. 30–200) capitula; bracteoles of most capitula mostly fewer than 5; first-year leaves forming a basal rosette; cypselas dimorphic- those of ray florets glabrous, those of disc florets with lines of short hairs
Inflorescence of up to c. 30 capitula; bracteoles of most capitula mostly more than 5; leaves not initially rosetted; cypselas uniform, either glabrous or hairy

Leaves with 0–4(–6) marginal points per side, not developing strap-like basal segments; mid-stem leaves with rachis mostly greater than 0.8 mm wide with length:width ratio less than 15 when dried; cypselas 1.8–2.8 mm long; mostly in north-west

Leaves with 0–40 marginal points per side, sometimes developing strap-like basal segments; mid-stem leaves with rachis less than 0.8 mm wide with length:width ratio greater than 15 when dried; cypselas (1.6–)2–4.5 mm long; mostly in south and east
Involucre 9–12.5 mm long; inflorescence often a single capitulum; decumbent to suberect rhizomatous perennial of sandy coasts
Involucre less than 8 mm long; inflorescence usually of several capitula
Involucral bracts 13 or fewer; ligulate florets to 6 mm long
Involucral bracts more than 13 in at least most capitula; ligulate florets (5–) 6–15 mm long
Rhizomatous, grey-leaved shrub, not or hardly aromatic; inflorescence of 1–few capitula; rare northern shrub of heavy ground prone to inundation
Non-rhizomatous herb or shrub, strongly aromatic; inflorescence corymbose, of c. 20–200 capitula; widespread, mainly in wet forests
Cypselas densely papillose-pubescent all over; pappus persistent; north-western and exceedingly rare (possibly extinct) in Victoria
Cypselas glabrous or shortly hairy in longitudinal rows; pappus deciduous
Bracteoles not or barely overlapping base of involucre; neither bracts nor bracteoles conspicuously black-tipped; cypselas 1.5–2.2 mm long, 0.3–0.5 mm diam.
Bracteoles overlapping base of involucre; both bracts and bracteoles conspicuously black-tipped; cypselas (1.6–)1.8–4.5 mm long, 0.5–0.8 mm diam.

Leaves with 0–4(–6) marginal points per side, not developing strap-like basal segments; mid-stem leaves rachis mostly greater than 0.8 mm wide with length:width ratio less than 15 when dried; cypselas 1.8–2.8 mm long; mostly in north-west

Leaves with 0–40 marginal points per side, sometimes developing strap-like basal segments; mid-stem leaves rachis less than 0.8 mm wide with length:width ratio greater than 15 when dried; cypselas (1.6–)2–4.5 mm long; mostly in south and east
Florets all bisexual, prominently exserted beyond involucre at anthesis
Outer florets female, inner florets bisexual, often barely exserted beyond involucre at anthesis
Involucral bracts 18–23, usually prominently black-tipped; annual weed of cultivation
Involucral bracts no more than 14, not black-tipped
Capitula with less than 25 florets; corollas of outer florets exceeding involucral bracts by 2–5 mm
Capitula with more than 25 florets; corollas of outer florets level with or exceeding involucral bracts by up to 2 mm
Leaves of major branches to 15 mm wide; reticulate venation of leaves obscure
Leaves of major branches to 50 mm wide; reticulate venation clearly defined on one or both surfaces

Margins of leaves of the major branches denticulate, dentate or lobate, flat or finely recurved; bracteoles with length:width ratio mostly greater than 3; peduncles commonly somewhat woolly at anthesis
Margins of leaves of the major branches entire (margin of stem leaves may be dentate), revolute; bracteoles with length:width ratio mostly less than 2; peduncles glabrous at anthesis
Plant not glaucous; mid-branch leaves tapering strongly to a petiole-like proximal portion 1–4 cm long, auricles absent or small, lower surface  ± completely obscured by indumentum

Plant often glaucous; mid-branch leaves not tapering strongly to a petiole-like proximal portion, auricles commonly well-developed and usually moderately stem-clasping; lower surface mostly glabrous or sparsely indumented,  rarely moderately obscured by indumentum
Leaves densely woolly on both surfaces,  inflorescence branchlets, peduncles and bracts densely woolly; bracteoles greater than 4 mm long
Leaves densely appressed woolly on lower surface only, inflorescence branchlets, peduncles and bracts sparsely woolly; bracteoles less than 4 mm long
Female florets rays without lobes or ligules; cypselas with hairs that exceed the pappus ring; inflorescence of 1–20 capitula
Female florets disc florets with 2–5 lobes; cypselas glabrous or with short papillose hairs; inflorescence of 10 to several hundred capitula
Involucral bracts 12 or 13 in majority of capitula; female florets 8–13; cypselas of female florets 3–6 mm long, slightly lageniform
Involucral bracts 7–10, or occasionally to 13, in a majority of capitula; female florets predominantly 4–8; cypselas of female florets 2–3.5 mm long, not lageniform
Cypselas glabrous, lustrous
Cypselas with papillose hairs or if glabrous then not lustrous
Stem creeping to erect, renewed annually from a short rhizome; subalpine
Stem erect, not renewed from a rhizome; lowland swamps
Involucres 2.8–5 mm wide in fresh material two thirds of the distance along the involucre from the base, all or most comprising 16–25 bracts
Involucres 1.0–3.0 mm wide, comprising 7–14 bracts
Cypselas lageniform, 3.0–6.0 mm long
Cypselas cylindric, 2.0–3.0 mm long
Leaves conspicuously retrorsely lobed
Leaves unlobed, or if lobed, segments not conspicuously retrorse
Capitula with up to 50% of florets female or at least with only female structures emergent from corolla tube and reduced corolla lobes
Capitula with 70–80% of florets female, very rarely with 50% of florets female
Stem creeping to erect, renewed annually from a short rhizome; subalpine
Stem erect, not renewed from a rhizome; widespread

Leaves broadest at the base, where clustered, becoming wider spaced and narrower up the stem, entire or occasionally with 1 or 2 lobes per side in proximal half, with short, multicellular flattened hairs

Leaves usually broadest throughout the midstem, not clustered at the base and more or less evenly spaced and sized throughout the midstem, entire to sub-pinnatisect, with or without short, multicellular flattened hairs
Lower stem bearing spreading multicellular flattened hairs; secondary roots usually slightly tuberiform
Lower stem without spreading multicellular flattened hairs; secondary roots never tuberiform
Cypselas 3.0–4.0 mm long; involucre 8.5–12.0 mm long
Cypselas 2.0–3.0 mm long; involucre 5.0–7.5 mm long
Capitula with 12–25 florets; bisexual florets 5–6.0 mm long; pappus 4.5–6.0 mm long
Capitula with 30–45 florets; bisexual florets 6–7.0 mm long; pappus 6.0–7.5 mm long
Leaves grey on both surfaces due to a woolly tomentum, elliptic
Leaves green on at least one surface or if grey on both surfaces then linear
Axils with precociously developing leafy growth above mid stem; leaves on both surfaces glabrous or nearly so; Gippsland river valleys
Axils without precociously developing leafy growth or if present then leaves clearly hairy; widespread
Stems glabrous or with cottony hairs; leaves entire, rarely lobate with 1–3 segments in proximal half; cypselas usually lageniform, rarely cylindric
Stems, at least basally, with sparse to dense short multicellular flattened hairs; leaves entire to sub-pinnatisect; cypselas cylindric, narrow-ellipsoid, rarely slightly lageniform
Plants multistemmed and much-branched in lower half in its first season; stem leaves with bidentate auricles
Plants usually not both multistemmed and branched in lower half in its first season; stem leaves with auriucles absent or present only above mid stem and then entire

Taproot well-developed; secondary roots hardly fleshy; stems moderately to densely appressed cottony or woolly (sometimes glabrescent with age); mid stem leave narrow-linear, length:width ratio greater than 20

Taproot slender, inconspicuous; secondary roots fleshy; stems glabrous or only sparsely cottony; mid stem leaves very narrow-elliptic to linear (usually distinctly tapering to each end), length:width ratio less than 20
Mid stem leaves less than 15 mm wide, length:width ration greater than 15; lower surface of leaves lacking coarse hairs; involucre 5–8 mm long; cypselas 2.5–4.5 mm long
Mid stem leaves greater than 15 mm wide, length:width ratio less than 10; lower surface of leaves frequently with short flattened, multicelled hairs ; involucre 7–9 mm long; cypselas 4–6 mm long
Leaves usually entire; short, multicellular, flattened hairs sparse on stems and leaves
Leaves usually regularly dissected more than a quarter of the distance to midrib; short, multicellular, flattened hairs scattered to moderately dense on stems and leaves
Leaves pinnatisect to sub-bipinnatisect, usually including upper leaves
Leaves not dissected deeper than deeply lobate or if ever pinnatisect then upper stem leaves usually not pinnatisect
Florets 40–60 per capitulum; cypselas 2.5–3 mm long; involucral bracts black at apex
Florets less than 40 per capitulum or if greater than 40 then either cypselas less than 2.5 mm or involucral bracts not black at apex
Peduncles and bracteoles, and often lower surface of upper stem leaves, cobwebby to woolly at anthesis
Peduncles and bracteoles ± glabrous or sparsely hairy at anthesis, lower surface of upper stem leaves  never cobwebby or woolly
Stems and lower surface of leaves often intensely purple; segments of lower leaves roughly semicircular, perpendicular to the midrib
Stems and lower surface of leaves mostly green, sometimes slightly to moderately purple; segments of lower leaves triangular, oblong or obovate, angled away from the stem
Cypselas 3.0–4.0 mm long, pale olive-brown, glabrous
Cypselas 1.5–3.2 mm long, tan, brown or red-brown, glabrous or with papillose hairs
Florets 18–45; involucral bracts usually 11–14
Florets 12–20; involucral bracts usually 7–10

Lower half of stems sparsely to moderately covered with flattened multicellular hairs, becoming rather sparse above mid stem; apex of involucral bracts with a small black spot less than 0.5 mm long; cypselas red-brown

Lower half of stems densely covered  with flattened multicellular hairs, usually remaining frequent in upper stem region and present on inflorescence branches; apex of involucral bracts marked with a purple zone c. 1 mm long; cypselas tan or chocolate-brown

Primary roots inconspicuous; secondary roots fleshy; leaves with a continuous medial band of lamina roughly oblong and the distal centimetre of leaves commonly with an oblong section 2–8 mm long; cypselas with a length:width ratio of c. 4–5

Primary roots well-developed; secondary roots not fleshy; leaves with the continuous medial band of lamina somewhat elliptic and the distal centimetre of leaves roughly triangular; cypselas with a length:width ratio of c. 6–7
